The point or pice at which you buy could determine the more profit you can get but that is based on how long for which you are ready to hold. We are currently in a bearish market although, its had to say if the market have actually made a dip as no one could clearly ascertain but, you can but at any point, hold and keep buying more when opportuned while, you continue to hold until you get desired profit.Note: Always use spare cash and this is far from an investment advice. DYOR.Be careful when it comes to altcoins, trading on signals and arbitrage trading.My advice for you at this phase would be that you try gaining knowledge on the forum and while demo trading if your interested in trading.

comments.author: CryptocurencyKing
comments.body: Oh boy! From my experience, I consider trading one of the most dangerous aspect to earning in cryptos. As a beginner, I would advice you don't jump into trading with your real money. Give it time to learn the basics about it and haven't gotten some experience, you could proceed to live trading on your own developed strategy. Speaking of earnings, you could earn where ever you could render a needed service. On the forum, there are a few services and contest that goes on periodically. Perhaps you could code a signature, design an ANN thread, you could manage a project, make accurate predictions on games and rounds, your good with arts and more. These are some of the opportunities available on the forum and earning in cryptos really means your medium of payment.Most of all, you could just invest in bitcoin for a long term by buying and hodling.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Quote from: Nyben on July 13, 2022, 01:28:55 PMI wish to get the needed guide on how and when to start trading Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies inorder to make some profits to settle some of my needs.  I will be honest, you cant expect to start trading a newbie without any prior trading experience in stocks or commodities and then hope to be able to cash out with a decent stash of money in order to pay bills. This is the type of unrealistic expectation that most people come in with and that eagerness to make quick money lands them up in the wrong place.Above users did some good searching for you, so use those articles to gain knowledge on trading but do not try open handed trading right away, you will make the mistake of buying at the wrong price. Try dummy trading for at least six months before starting real life trading.In the meantime try to get a side earning to pay off your bills. Dont try to use a speculative market earning for that. You never know how bad things can get here.

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: Your focus point should be how to trade and not when, how to trade is very important and also very risky as well. As a beginner, I would suggest not to be in a hurry to trade, do enough research on the internet, and gather all needed and necessary materials on trading to enable you to gain all the required knowledge to trade. there are lots of video tutorials on youtube that can also serve as a good source of learning. Trading is a risky aspect of crypto so it is important you are prepared both financially and mentally, especially mentally because the beginning will not be smooth sailing so you have to be prepared.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Short term trading is like gambling, you can't expect to make guaranteed income from this activity for a living. If you want to trade you need to be prepared to receive your first earnings after years of investment, by being a long time holder. The currently bitcoin price is relatively cheap, considering how further it has already reached last year (almost 60,000$). So you are a lucky person to be on the right place at right time, having access to an opportunity which is going to be missed by most people in this world. It's up to you to take this chance and to organize yourself financially to be able to hold for the period of time mentioned above, if necessary.

comments.author: BTCat
comments.body: Trading with fake money is useless. Why? Because you will not be the same person when it becomes real.Your decisions will be totally different because now you have real fear and it's about something to take serious.With fake money you easily go all-in, while when it's about your real 'hark worked for' money then you will be very carefull. Basically when you trade fake money you will learn the wrong strategies. Solution: Take a cheap altcoin and trade with 10% of what you normally do. Now you will feel the real stress of dealing with real money.And you won't be making careless decisions.To start I suggest to earn money from bounty campaigns and signatures and only trade with that. Do not ever deposit your own money.
